results.title: Vitamin B12 Deficiency and Clinical Neuropathy with Metformin Use in Type 2 Diabetes
results.text_hl: The data from our study showed that, with an increase in the dose of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, the @<m>DISEASE_Nervous_System_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009422 @@@neuropathy@@@ scores performed by TCSS increased, which suggests that @<m>DISEASE_Nervous_System_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009422 @@@neuropathy@@@ worsens as the cumulative dose of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ increases.

citations.NLM: Farooq MD, Tak FA, Ara F, Rashid S, Mir IA. Vitamin B12 Deficiency and Clinical Neuropathy with Metformin Use in Type 2 Diabetes J Xenobiot. 2022 May 31;12(2):122-130. PMID: 35736024

results.title: Is metformin a possible treatment for diabetic neuropathy?
results.text_hl: In clinical use, however, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ is associated with reduced plasma @CHEMICAL_Vitamin_B_12 @CHEMICAL_MESH:D014805 @@@vitamin B12@@@ levels, which can further @<m>DISEASE_Nervous_System_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009422 @@@neuropathy@@@.
